thoughts.vibe: . This place is awesome. There’s two rooms, one with a coffee bar and one a makerspace with a bike fixing shop (!!!). Great spot to work.
thoughts.taste: . The coffee was super well made, slightly on the acidic side but generally very balanced. Smooth taste.

name: Brewlab
visitAgain: 4 - Would come again if I’m anywhere in the city

thoughts.vibe: . Honestly didn’t expect such a cool vibe from a coffee shop off the highway but here we are. Good vibes great merch.
thoughts.taste: . The coffee is incredible. So much so I bought merch.

name: Well Coffeehouse
visitAgain: 4 - Would come again if I’m anywhere in the city
address:
7618 Hwy 70S
Unit 107
Nashville, TN 37221
United States

thoughts.vibe: . Super pink super cute. It’s located on the outside of a hotel but the hotel vibe doesn’t come through. Everyone super friendly as well.
thoughts.taste: . Really good coffee as well!!

name: Pink Hermit Cafe
visitAgain: 3 - Would visit again if I’m in the area
address:
231 Sixth Ave N
Nashville, TN  37219
United States

thoughts.vibe: . This place is the perfect working environment. It’s unfortunate that they close early, because if not I’d work here for hours and hours. It’s a residential house (very nice house, might I add) where the bottom floor has been converted into a cafe. Great decor, good vibes, good music.
thoughts.taste: . The coffee was also great, it was a hot day and the iced latte is what I needed. Was not watered down in the slightest.

name: The Quarters Coffee House
visitAgain: 5 - Would drive many hours to get to this place

thoughts.vibe: . This is hidden away between huge corporate buildings but after stepping in you can’t tell you’re in the heart of capitalism. Very cozy and the people are super friendly!
thoughts.taste: . I got the raspberry latte which was tasty but the raspberry syrup was a bit overpowering. The coffee taste was pretty enjoyable though.

name: The lighthouse
visitAgain: 4 - Would come again if I’m anywhere in the city
address:
685 Gateway Blvd
South San Francisco, CA 94080
United States

thoughts.vibe: . Minimalistic, great music, great decor. Good wifi, amazing people. Very good scent.
thoughts.taste: . I got a light sweet matcha which was really good! It was quite foamy, which I personally don’t mind. It tasted great.

name: Dr.ink
visitAgain: 4 - Would come again if I’m anywhere in the city
address: 77 N Almaden Ave Suite 70, San Jose, CA 95110

thoughts.vibe: . Super chill, great spot to work. LOVE the decor and everything. Good music, good people.
thoughts.taste: . Yes. Love this coffee. Strong espresso taste but not overpowering - didn’t really have notes of anything but super smooth and well made. Love.

name: Canteen Coffee
visitAgain: 4 - Would come again if I’m anywhere in the city

thoughts.vibe: . This place reminds me of college. There’s a bunch of people here studying, working, drawing, yapping, and it makes me super nostalgic. A lot of seating, huge windows, great place to spend hours on end.
thoughts.taste: . Their menu has traditional coffee drinks, but has location inspired coffee drinks on top. I got the Manila, which was a Ube + Mango + Coconut drink, which I expected to be very sweet but was incredibly balanced and tasted great.

name: Voyager Coffee
visitAgain: 4 - Would come again if I’m anywhere in the city
address: 87 N San Pedro St, San Jose, CA 95110

thoughts.vibe: . This place was super spacious, well lit, had a super cool backyard and lots of spaces to work. The vibes were high!
thoughts.taste: . The coffee was roasted inhouse and tasted great (bold espresso taste + not too milky). ALSO the banana bread was super tasty.

name: Black Oak Coffee Roasters
visitAgain: 4 - Would come again if I’m anywhere in the city

thoughts.vibe: Love their backyard (except when it’s raining) and there is good indoor space which makes it perfect to work in. Good decor generally and feels like a very cozy place
thoughts.taste: I usually get a cappuccino or latte here, which I enjoy. I just wish the coffee taste was stronger. Consistency and texture wise very nicely balanced.

name: Verve Coffee Roasters
visitAgain: 3 - Would visit again if I’m in the area

thoughts.vibe: . Twas poppin! Good natural light, lots of people. Maybe a little too many, might’ve been a little congested but overall quite nice.
thoughts.taste: . Really good coffee, loved the espresso flavor.

name: Cafe Borrone
visitAgain: 3 - Would visit again if I’m in the area

thoughts.vibe: . Perfect decor! Super cute, lots of outdoor seating, much less indoors though. Cute music, cute setup. Really nice.
thoughts.taste: . It’s bold. The espresso tastes very strong, which is good. It was a little too milky but generally super well made.

name: Andytown Coffee Roasters
visitAgain: 3 - Would visit again if I’m in the area
address: 1302 El Camino Real, Menlo Park, CA 94025

thoughts.vibe: . Super french. Super cafe. Not a work spot, but super chill to come hang out with people. Has outdoor seating.
thoughts.taste: . Strong espresso taste. Well made. Cheaper than others I’ve had around.

name: Mademoiselle Colette
visitAgain: 3 - Would visit again if I’m in the area
address: 816 Santa Cruz Ave, Menlo Park, CA 94025

thoughts.vibe: . Whatever you’re looking to do, this place is super cool. If you’re there to work, they have an upper area to do just that or if you’re there to hang out they have a bunch of seating. The place is well lit and the staff is very chill.
thoughts.taste: . The coffee was okay. The espresso taste was there, but it was a little too milky.

name: Red Rock Coffee
visitAgain: 3 - Would visit again if I’m in the area

thoughts.vibe: . Super cool work space! Big windows, good lighting, super spacious.
thoughts.taste: . Very … basic. Not really a rich taste or make, which is not my vibe. Seems like I could make it.

name: Coffeebar
visitAgain: 2 - Would stop by if I stumble upon this place again

thoughts.vibe: : It's a shack with outdoor seating.
thoughts.taste: . A little too acidic for my liking. Didn't blow me away.

name: Saint Frank’s Coffee
visitAgain: 2 - Would stop by if I stumble upon this place again

thoughts.vibe: . Super cozy, super cute place. It’s raining and grey outside, and this is exactly where I’d wanna be in this weather. Not the most spacious, but it’s great.
thoughts.taste: ! Not sure what beans these are, but strong espresso taste and a super well made coffee. Coffee taste might be up there w sightglass.

name: 1369 Coffee
visitAgain: 4 - Would come again if I’m anywhere in the city
address:
757 Massachusetts Ave
Cambridge, MA 02139
United States

thoughts.vibe: . Pretty vintage, but a little crowded. It was hard to get by tables. If you’re looking for a good hangout, this is a great spot! Not a place you’d be able to work though.
thoughts.taste: . Very standard coffee, little on the milky side and couldn’t taste the espresso much at all.

name: Cafe Vittoria
visitAgain: 2 - Would stop by if I stumble upon this place again

thoughts.vibe: . Honestly, this was a fascinating place, definitely one if its kind of all the places I’ve been to so far. The barista there was incredible, she chatted with us for a while while our coffee was being made (apparently it’s just 1 person that runs the shop, the owner aside). She told us the lore of how their specialty, the coco cold brew came to be - one of their hungover neighbors would come to the shop, get a coconut water and then cold brew before their way out. One day, they were running late, so they mixed the two and voila, the unique drink was formed. The environment was very comfortable, reminded me of a regular tea stall you might go to on your way out of the house in India.
thoughts.taste: . My friend ordered the coco cold brew and that was fascinating. Had 3 layers of taste, and it was honestly unlike anything I’d had before. Their espresso machine wasn’t working and I got the North Beach, and despite not being the biggest non-espresso coffee drinker, this was fantastic. The notes came through in the pour over, it was sweet but just the right amount.

name: HITW Coffee
visitAgain: 6 - Would fly in to come to this place again

thoughts.vibe: . Very cute little shop in an alley, not very much seating space but I love their decor! People were super nice too - line is usually out the door though.
thoughts.taste: I got their Pandan Matcha Latte and it was phenomenal. This particular drink was definitely more of a treat coffee, but their latte is amazing too. Highly recommend.

name: Golden Goat Coffee
visitAgain: 6 - Would fly in to come to this place again

thoughts.vibe: : It was almost hard to find lol, but it’s super cozy, great little setup. The one downside is that there isn’t much seating, but it’s a few blocks from the beach so just headed there to sip my coffee.
thoughts.taste: : Super nice coffee! Smooth texture, pretty balanced espresso taste (which does mean that it wasn’t as bold as I like it, but it was still damn fine.)

name: Damnfine Coffee
visitAgain: 4 - Would come again if I’m anywhere in the city

thoughts.vibe: . I’ve yet to see anything that’s close to King St in terms of vibe but this gets really close. This is on a super cute block, good vibes with plants and a coffee bar setup. Outdoor seating as well. Nice.
thoughts.taste: . Really good cappuccino. I also really like their pastries.

name: Vive La Tarte
visitAgain: 4 - Would come again if I’m anywhere in the city
address:
4026 24th St
San Francisco, CA 94114
United States

thoughts.vibe: . Super cozy, super nice. Looks like it’s a 100 years old, bunch of plants. Bernie (also the barista) was amazing, gave us great suggestions.
thoughts.taste: ! Got a honey hazelnut latte, it hit the spot. Right what I needed at the time, not terribly sweet, not overpowering flavors, great taste. A friend of mine got an americano with Oatmilk which was also incredible.

name: Bernie’s
visitAgain: 4 - Would come again if I’m anywhere in the city

thoughts.vibe: . Fascinating space, loved it! They have a roastery in the back, it was very spacious and and was well lit. Super cute cups too lol.
thoughts.taste: . The foam was super acidic which made the taste bad to begin with, but after I stirred it in, the coffee was awesome. Espresso tasted light and sweet and the consistency was really nice.

name: Four Barrel Coffee
visitAgain: 4 - Would come again if I’m anywhere in the city

thoughts.vibe: . Very well lit, great wifi, great people, great spot to hang out and chat or get a lot of work done. I sat there for quite a few hours, first working and then people watching and never got tired of it.
thoughts.taste: . The coffee was awesome! The espresso flavor was on the sweeter side but the coffee had a great balance. Would get again.

name: Home Coffee Roasters
visitAgain: 4 - Would come again if I’m anywhere in the city

thoughts.vibe: . This place is energizing!! It’s located in the Center for Architecture + Design so naturally it has amazing decor.
thoughts.taste: . The coffee was very solid. Got a latte, the espresso came through and tasted great.

name: Cento Coffee Systeme D
visitAgain: 4 - Would come again if I’m anywhere in the city

thoughts.vibe: . Def lives up to the name, extremely friendly people and generally a very welcoming place. Would spend a day working here for sure.
thoughts.taste: . Nothing too fancy, standard good cup of coffee. It was a rainy day and the coffee definitely hit the spot.

name: Neighbor’s Corner
visitAgain: 4 - Would come again if I’m anywhere in the city
address:
499 Douglass St
San Francisco, CA 94114
United States

thoughts.vibe: : Located in a small corner shop, cute little coffee cart. Didn’t have much seating though except some outside.
thoughts.taste: . Really good coffee. Tasted really smooth and bold, was hot and great consistency.

name: Third Wheel Coffee
visitAgain: 4 - Would come again if I’m anywhere in the city

thoughts.vibe: . This place is how I’d like to set up my eventual cafe. It has only a few spots to sit, but each one of them is very very cozy. They always have great music and great vibes.
thoughts.taste: . Their banana latte might be one of my favorite coffee drinks. They used mashed bananas so the drink itself is chunky, which I really like. I haven’t seen this being done in many other coffee places, though I’m sure they’re not the first.

name: Earth Tone Cafe
visitAgain: 4 - Would come again if I’m anywhere in the city

thoughts.vibe: . I came to this place after I saw a reel about it, which probably explains the long line when I got there. Waited for about 15 minutes. The coffee was expensive, but the sitting area (if you can snag a spot) was cute.
thoughts.taste: . I got the pandan latte w a double shot and it was extremely tasty. It was light, but I could distinctly taste the espresso which had a distinct flavor.

name: Kopiku Coffee
visitAgain: 4 - Would come again if I’m anywhere in the city

thoughts.vibe: . This place is sick! There are multiple cars on display (which are apparently rotated through, though I can’t confirm) but you can sit inside one of the cars too. Great place to work, super spacious and super well lit.
thoughts.taste: . Got a cappuccino, didn’t expect chocolate in it but it worked nonetheless. The coffee taste was good though was masked by the chocolate.

name: Motoring Cafe
visitAgain: 4 - Would come again if I’m anywhere in the city

thoughts.vibe: . Can see this being a 5 for a bunch of people, the place is massive, recently opened so it’s very clean, the decor is clean and the layout is spacious. Decor is traditional - my only down side is that this would probably not be a work 8 hours a day kinda space.
thoughts.taste: . Got the sana’a latte. It’s bold. Interesting. Have not tasted anything like this before. It has cardamom and some other spices in it which gives it a very unique flavor. 4 / 5 because it was $7.20 🥲

name: Sana’a Coffee
visitAgain: 4 - Would come again if I’m anywhere in the city
address:
199 New Montgomery St
San Francisco, CA 94105
United States

thoughts.vibe: ! Suuuuper cute. Minimalistic with plants, also really nice decor. People were super nice and there’s outdoor seating.
thoughts.taste: . Really good roast, and well made coffee. The coffee tastes light and airy (which is perfectly good)!

name: Ritual Coffee Roasters
visitAgain: 3 - Would visit again if I’m in the area
address:
1026 Valencia St
San Francisco, CA 94110
United States

thoughts.vibe: : Another one of a kind shop which I stumbled upon on a stroll through Golden Gate park. It’s a caravan that was decorated like a coffee shop with cute decor and some benches nearby which made it a great place to stop and get some coffee.
thoughts.taste: : I really enjoyed the latte, but I felt like the espresso taste was a bit overpowered by the milk proportion. Still great consistency and flavor.

name: California Kahve
visitAgain: 3 - Would visit again if I’m in the area

thoughts.vibe: . Super cute, has lots of outdoor seating, inside felt a little cramped. Baristas were alright!
thoughts.taste: . Super great coffee! It was great flavor, great ratios, great blend of creaminess and flavor. Super nice.

name: Noe Cafe
visitAgain: 3 - Would visit again if I’m in the area

thoughts.vibe: . Solid work spot barring the lack of charging points. It can also be a little noisy because they’re usually roasting beans around, but still the upstairs area is great to work out of.
thoughts.taste: . Love Sightglass. It’s probably some of my favorite tasting beans - they’re awesome. Perfect strong espresso taste, and coffee was very well made as well.

name: Sightglass Coffee
visitAgain: 3 - Would visit again if I’m in the area

thoughts.vibe: . Cute little corner shop I loved the reddish pink color theme (coffee shops def need to embrace color more). Not very big but def very cute. Also really like that it’s called Coffee lab.
thoughts.taste: . Sightglass! Good coffee per usual. Well made too! I know I consume a lot of sightglass because I could tell the taste 😭

name: Spro Coffee Lab
visitAgain: 3 - Would visit again if I’m in the area
address:
500 Church St
San Francisco, CA 94114
United States

thoughts.vibe: : Old cafe run by an old (Turkish?) uncle. Not too many people there, felt like I went back in time when I entered. Super reminiscent of shops back home, but it was slightly dirty.
thoughts.taste: : Got a cardamom latte and ngl it worked really well! Reminded me of cardamom in chai so that’s probably why as well. Good coffee and was super quick.

name: Cafe La Boheme
visitAgain: 3 - Would visit again if I’m in the area
address:
3318 24th St
San Francisco, CA 94110
United States

thoughts.vibe: : Small cute cafe by the beach, had some great outdoor seating but felt a little cramped. Definitely good spaces to sit if you can snag one though.
thoughts.taste: : The coffee was very good! The latte was not too hot (like I prefer) but the sweet espresso taste came through and it was balanced in its milkiness

name: Java Beach Cafe
visitAgain: 3 - Would visit again if I’m in the area
address:
1396 La Playa St
San Francisco, CA 94122
United States

thoughts.vibe: : Corner shop, not a lot of seating space but very cute! Has some outdoor seating and def a good place to work if you can snag a spot.
thoughts.taste: : Good consistency, though the milkiness overpowered a little bit. Espresso taste was really good.

name: La Stanzione
visitAgain: 3 - Would visit again if I’m in the area

thoughts.vibe: . It was a great setup, they had a little coffee bar area which I’m a fan of. There was very limited seating which was a bit of a bummer.
thoughts.taste: . Really well made coffee - they roast their own beans and they had that setup in the back, and it tasted very light and perfectly acidic which was awesome.

name: Wrecking Ball Coffee Roasters
visitAgain: 3 - Would visit again if I’m in the area

thoughts.vibe: . Minimalistic decor, the barista was great. Limited seating but we managed to snag a spot outside and it was pretty quiet and chill.
thoughts.taste: . Got a cortado which tasted great, espresso was bold and intense which we love.

name: Ikon Coffee
visitAgain: 3 - Would visit again if I’m in the area

thoughts.vibe: . It was super cute, good seating arrangement and the people were very nice.
thoughts.taste: . I got one of their flavored lattes and it was very well balanced with the espresso flavor.

name: Bazaar Cafe
visitAgain: 3 - Would visit again if I’m in the area
address:
5927 California St
San Francisco, CA 94121
United States

thoughts.vibe: . It’s by duboce park, so super cute and cozy. I like the place a lot.
thoughts.taste: . The coffee taste is bold. Pretty acidic too. I like it but not the hugest fan.

name: Duboce Cafe
visitAgain: 3 - Would visit again if I’m in the area
address:
2 Sanchez St
San Francisco, CA  94114
United States

thoughts.vibe: . I love the vibe! They’re decidedly a no laptop / no wifi place and brand them as such. Great to chill here. The only issue is that you can’t work here.
thoughts.taste: . Hot day, got an iced matcha latte. It was quite good! Also got a croissant which was quite good too.

name: Farley’s Coffee
visitAgain: 3 - Would visit again if I’m in the area
address:
1315 18th St
San Francisco, CA 94107
United States

thoughts.vibe: . Super cute bar setup with a small coffee setup next to it. Could sit there and talk for days.
thoughts.taste: . Smooth but a little too milky. Would’ve liked bolder espresso taste

name: Iron Horse Coffee
visitAgain: 3 - Would visit again if I’m in the area
address:
25 Maiden Ln
San Francisco, CA 94108
United States

thoughts.vibe: . Very victorian? spacious w books.
thoughts.taste: . The latte was not bad but very milky.

name: La Promenade
visitAgain: 3 - Would visit again if I’m in the area
address:
3643 Balboa St
San Francisco, CA 94121
United States

thoughts.vibe: . Comfy couches and lots of sunlight + books / games, very cool place to chill at.
thoughts.taste: . Their coffee was okay — little diluted but tasty nonetheless.

name: Coffee to the People
visitAgain: 3 - Would visit again if I’m in the area

thoughts.vibe: . This is the Equator shack in Fort mason. I really like this location because you can go for a walk along the pier right after grabbing coffee. There’s no real place to sit, but it’s a great spot to stop by.
thoughts.taste: . I got their Habibi latte, which had vanilla + cinnamon + something I forget. Personally, the Sana’a latte at Sana’a cafe is better. I guess that’s what they get for cultural appropriation.

name: Equator Coffees
visitAgain: 3 - Would visit again if I’m in the area

thoughts.vibe: . It’s super cute and a good location to work.
thoughts.taste: . I got the cappuccino which was solid. Pretty foamy, good bold espresso taste, nothing to complain about.

name: Verve Coffee Roasters
visitAgain: 3 - Would visit again if I’m in the area

thoughts.vibe: . Huge fan of their logo. The inside was bright but a little cramped, but still a great spot to work.
thoughts.taste: . Their cappuccino was bold but slightly sweet, well made! I didn’t have a chance to try their specials but the people ordering them seemed to be enjoying them.

name: Pixlcat Coffee
visitAgain: 3 - Would visit again if I’m in the area

thoughts.vibe: . I was here on a cloudy day and this place was perfect, snug and cozy. Good chill music, also has outdoor seating. Can spend hours here.
thoughts.taste: . It’s good standard coffee. Nothing extraordinary, but standard and good. Would recommend as a starting coffee for sure.

name: Martha & Bros Coffee Co.
visitAgain: 2 - Would stop by if I stumble upon this place again
address:
3868 24th St
San Francisco, CA 94114
United States

thoughts.vibe: . Super cute! People are really nice but not that much seating space. In the middle of a neighborhood so quite quiet but really enjoyed sitting here.
thoughts.taste: . Well made coffee, decently creamy and balanced but didn’t love the taste of the espresso.

name: Day Moon
visitAgain: 2 - Would stop by if I stumble upon this place again

thoughts.vibe: : It’s kinda cute. There’s good outdoor seating, inside is old but sturdy. People were super nice!
thoughts.taste: . It was alright. Not life changing, but solid coffee. Would’ve liked it if was hotter. Def got my caffeine fix.

name: Diamond Cafe
visitAgain: 2 - Would stop by if I stumble upon this place again

thoughts.vibe: . It was quite cute! They had this lil coffee train thing at the back which was exciting to see (have never seen it so far).
thoughts.taste: . It’s … too milky. Couldn’t taste the coffee at all. In their defense, seemed like they specialize in cold brew, which I totally believe. They had some other exciting flavors too, just not my type.

name: UpForDayz
visitAgain: 2 - Would stop by if I stumble upon this place again
address:
1198 Valencia St
San Francisco, CA 94110
United States

thoughts.vibe: : Cute little shop with good outdoor seating, felt very homey with people just vibing. The vibes felt off with the barista though, they were rushing me through my order like they just wanted me out of there.
thoughts.taste: . Nothing spectacular, but I liked the addition of foam on top of my iced latte. Tasted pretty solid.

name: The Beanery
visitAgain: 2 - Would stop by if I stumble upon this place again
address:
1307 9th Ave
San Francisco, CA 94122
United States

thoughts.vibe: . Place was popping! I liked the decor but they went a little heavy with the halloween theme to the point that it was genuinely creepy.
thoughts.taste: . It was good solid coffee and well made. Nothing standout, very safe.

name: Wooden Coffeehouse
visitAgain: 2 - Would stop by if I stumble upon this place again

thoughts.vibe: . Not very much my kind of place - didn’t have a lot of seating and was cramped, but their decor was super cute.
thoughts.taste: . I got their seasonal special latte, which was tasty! Flavors balanced nicely and was not too sweet.

name: The Coffee Movement
visitAgain: 2 - Would stop by if I stumble upon this place again
address:
1030 Washington St
San Francisco, CA 94109
United States

thoughts.vibe: The place was super cute! Went here early morning to get some coffee after a flight and would sit here for a while if I had the time.
thoughts.taste: : Latte was a little too milky and didn’t give the coffee taste, but the foam was quite tasty.

name: Temos Coffee
visitAgain: 2 - Would stop by if I stumble upon this place again
address:
3000 24th St
San Francisco, CA 94110
United States

thoughts.vibe: . Super cute, very cozy and had lots of seating. Super full too with work spots.
thoughts.taste: . Wasn’t the strongest espresso taste, and everything got meddled up. Not the best coffee I’ve ever had.

name: Cafe Reveille
visitAgain: 2 - Would stop by if I stumble upon this place again
address:
1998 Polk St
San Francisco, CA 94109
United States

thoughts.vibe: . It’s a super cute place, maybe a lil technologically advanced bc i don’t wanna order on qr codes but decor wise very cute.
thoughts.taste: . Quite diluted. Didn’t taste espresso at all

name: Cafe de Casa
visitAgain: 2 - Would stop by if I stumble upon this place again
address:
3985 17th St
San Francisco, CA 94114
United States

thoughts.vibe: . Very well lit and lots of seating. Great place to work. Has good wifi.
thoughts.taste: . I got the iced matcha which was not bad. Little diluted, but tasted decent!

name: Le Cafe du Soleil
visitAgain: 2 - Would stop by if I stumble upon this place again

thoughts.vibe: . It’s a bookstore, of course it has great vibes. This place has a very nice backyard (with a deconstructable golden gate bridge) and super cute seating which is private enough despite being in a shared space. Very cool design.
thoughts.taste: . Their cortado was VERY bold. And by that I mean the espresso taste was a little overpowering. A great tasting espresso, but overpowering nonetheless.

name: Blackbird Bookstore and Cafe
visitAgain: 3 - Would visit again if I’m in the area

thoughts.vibe: . There’s a super cozy corner which I unfortunately didn’t get to sit in but I knew I’d spent a long time in if I did. Great wifi, great working atmosphere, good vibes. They had a sand heating setup for Turkish coffee which was quite cool too.
thoughts.taste: . My first taste of Turkish Coffee! It was pitched to me as “bold as espresso but not as bitter” and honestly held completely true to the description. I still prefer espresso, but definitely worth the experience.

name: Telve Cafe
visitAgain: 3 - Would visit again if I’m in the area

thoughts.vibe: . Super boujee, super fancy but also super cozy. A very unsuspecting spot, hard to tell what it is but once you’re inside it’s a great place to work and hang out.
thoughts.taste: . I got a toasted coconut latte. The coconut flavor was good but REALLY strong. The first few sips were great, but once the flavor settled a little bit the last few were hard to get through.

name: The Buoy
visitAgain: 3 - Would visit again if I’m in the area

thoughts.vibe: . The surrounding area is great, but the truck itself is in a heavily trafficked spot where everyone’s coming to grab lunch. The walk afterwards is pristine though.
thoughts.taste: . I got their seasonal special but received a matcha instead. The matcha was okay, but was too milky and the matcha taste (or any other flavor, which were added) didn’t come through at all.

name: California Kahve - Presidio
visitAgain: 2 - Would stop by if I stumble upon this place again
address: Presidio Tunnel Top, 210 Lincoln Blvd, San Francisco, CA 94123

thoughts.vibe: . This is an okay place to work, but a little hard to find outlets. They didn’t have wifi either. They do have good seating though.
thoughts.taste: . The coffee here was okay. Too diluted so didn’t taste the best.

name: Union Coffee Roastery
visitAgain: 2 - Would stop by if I stumble upon this place again

thoughts.vibe: . This place is very cute, though I might be biased because I came here on a date. But I really like their decor, they have great spots to sit. This would make a great place to work. They have great desserts too.
thoughts.taste: . The coffee was good! It was a strong espresso taste and blistering hot, which I really like.

name: Diamond Coffee and Pastry
visitAgain: 3 - Would visit again if I’m in the area

thoughts.vibe: . Great lighting, but this place was uninspiring. Felt like a beat down spot where no one, including the people running the place, wanted to be.
thoughts.taste: . The coffee was really watered down so it almost felt like I was drinking a glass of cold milk.

name: The Beanery
visitAgain: 1 - Would not visit again

thoughts.vibe: . This felt like a classic beach town coffee shop. Breezy, very well lit. Couldn’t sit here to work but I don’t think that’s the intended effect.
thoughts.taste: . The coffee was okay. I got a cappuccino which was closer to a latte, which is fine, but I suppose the takeaway is that expect your drinks to feel a little diluted.

name: Java Beach at the zoo
visitAgain: 2 - Would stop by if I stumble upon this place again

thoughts.vibe: . Very well lit, the people were awesome. They had a grinding setup but also had a brewery setup which was super cool. Didn’t get a chance to go to their nightclub setup though.
thoughts.taste: . One of the best espresso based drinks I’ve ever had. I got the Warhol2.0, which was coconut + citrus + cinnamon and espresso and it was incredible. Every sip was amazing, and the flavors balanced out each other very very well.

name: Dayglow Coffee
visitAgain: 6 - Would fly in to come to this place again

thoughts.vibe: SO CUTE. Really tucked away, kinda hard to find honestly lol. Very cozy, very cute decorations. Honestly looked like a snow cabin with a great view.
thoughts.taste: The barista recommended the brown sugar latte and OH MY GOD it was so good. Really good balance in texture, really good balance in sweetness where the flavor didn’t overpower the sweetness. Would 100% get again.

name: Perk Coffee
visitAgain: 5 - Would drive many hours to get to this place

thoughts.vibe: SO COZY, So many plants, great decor, people were the friendliest, amazing ambiance to work
thoughts.taste: SUCH smooth coffee, got a hazelnut latte. The taste was great. The Hazelnut was amazing, espresso was really really nice

name: King’s Street Coffee
visitAgain: 4 - Would come again if I’m anywhere in the city

thoughts.vibe: Very small place but immaculate vibes. Very cute decor but can only seat like 5 people at a time. But if you get the one cute spot they have it’s SO nice.
thoughts.taste: Hazelnut latte, amazing. Exactly what I needed at the time.

name: Sorella Coffee
visitAgain: 4 - Would come again if I’m anywhere in the city

thoughts.vibe: . The store is small but the surrounding is very cute! Only outdoors so def a very summer vibe.
thoughts.taste: . Very tasty, espresso came off strong and wasn’t too milky or watery.

name: Black Fox Coffee
visitAgain: 4 - Would come again if I’m anywhere in the city
address:
550 Madison Ave
55th & 56th Streets
New York, NY 10022
United States

thoughts.vibe: . Shop is in the basement with stairs leading to it. I love the decor, it’s grafittied and has very cute decor in general.
thoughts.taste: . Very god coffee! Perfectly balanced, good foam and taste.

name: St Kilda Coffee
visitAgain: 4 - Would come again if I’m anywhere in the city

thoughts.vibe: I loved the decor of this place. It wasn’t too busy, great vibes, great music choice. The only reason it’s not a 5 is bc they didn’t have a conducive work environment (no wifi, no bathroom) so I couldn’t spend as long as I wanted to here.
thoughts.taste: Got a lavender latte, REALLY liked the flavor. It was a little too sweet despite getting just 1 pump of lavender. Well prepared, and the barista made me a sweet little flower on top too.

name: Le Café Coffee
visitAgain: 3 - Would visit again if I’m in the area

thoughts.vibe: Plants just make the vibe go up so much and this place is also a plant shop so obviously great vibes. Really good location, very calming spot.
thoughts.taste: Got a latte, really smooth and great taste. Was very balanced sweetness wise despite not getting any flavors or sugar.

name: PlantShed
visitAgain: 3 - Would visit again if I’m in the area

thoughts.vibe: Brick and mortar decor combined with very classy decor gave this place a very warm and homely feeling. Super cozy and a great place to get work done
thoughts.taste: Got a Cortado, super bold and rich tasting and it came through really nicely. Will credit this place for making me a cortado person.

name: Devocion
visitAgain: 3 - Would visit again if I’m in the area

thoughts.vibe: Pretty solid location but had no chargers or wifi. Generic coffee shop decor which I can’t complain about, but really had a hard time stopping by here to work.
thoughts.taste: Got an espresso matcha latte which was phenomenal. Had never had that combination before but it was so so good. The drink had layers and each tasted very good but once combined it was magical and I don’t think I can go back to normal matcha lattes ever.

name: 10000 Coffee
visitAgain: 3 - Would visit again if I’m in the area

thoughts.vibe: . Very cute setup, great soft music and a great place to get work done. This is also a flower shop which is quite calming as you work.
thoughts.taste: . Good bold espresso taste which I enjoyed.

name: Cafe Atelier
visitAgain: 3 - Would visit again if I’m in the area

thoughts.vibe: . Def more of a summertime shop with only outside seating. Otherwise p small interior but very cute, feels very curated (people were wearing gloves and stuff while making espresso).
thoughts.taste: . Very smooth but still very tasteful. Good espresso m

name: Zibetto Espresso Bar
visitAgain: 3 - Would visit again if I’m in the area
address:
1385 Sixth Ave 56th St
New York, NY 10019
United States

thoughts.vibe: Solid location, nice decor and I loved that plant wall with the logo on it. Feels a little cramped with the seating.
thoughts.taste: Got a double espresso, really liked the taste. Espressos are usually not my go to but I enjoyed this one. Would get again.

name: Gregory’s Coffee
visitAgain: 2 - Would stop by if I stumble upon this place again

thoughts.vibe: Vibes felt off ever since I walked in, the barista didn’t respond to me saying hello or anything. Didn’t feel cozy or personable really, though really liked talking to the person that brought my coffee out. It also felt a little too boujee for my taste.
thoughts.taste: Got a matcha latte, which was really tasty. Didn’t feel too sweet or too bland, good taste and great consistency. Didn’t have to see anything.

name: La Cabra
visitAgain: 2 - Would stop by if I stumble upon this place again

thoughts.vibe: Super cute shop! Nestled away in a corner, super cozy. Had great lighting, really cool “in caffeinated people we trust” sign and art around the shop.
thoughts.taste:
: 
Got a hazelnut latte but the hazelnut was overpowered. Personally don’t mind that but felt like a waste of money to get the flavor. Overall the latte was smooth, foam was pretty creamy but the rest of the latte felt a little watered down.

name: 787 Coffee
visitAgain: 2 - Would stop by if I stumble upon this place again

thoughts.vibe: Super fancy vibes from this place, seemed like somewhere business meetings happen for sure. The counter was in the middle and was closer to a coffee bar which was pretty good. Pretty solid place to work, especially if you get one of the good seats.
thoughts.taste: Got an iced latte on this particularly hot day, and it delivered! I asked for less ice but there was a little too much which watered it down eventually, but no complaints on the quality and balance of the drink itself.

name: Felix Roasting Co
visitAgain: 2 - Would stop by if I stumble upon this place again
address: 450 Park Ave S, New York, NY 10016

thoughts.vibe: . This is a super solid work spot with outlets and the vibe but they didn’t have wifi. They have a great setup so I think they expect people to be working but no wifi sours it a little bit.
thoughts.taste: . Got a cappuccino - little too acidic which spoils the taste a little bit.

name: Gotan
visitAgain: 2 - Would stop by if I stumble upon this place again

thoughts.vibe: . Corner store vibes, small cozy entryway but expands into a bigger seating section. Brick and mortar, which is always nice vibes.
thoughts.taste: . Devocion beans, and coffee was well made! Espresso was acidic but was nicely balanced by the milk

name: Vineapple
visitAgain: 2 - Would stop by if I stumble upon this place again

thoughts.vibe: . It was super cute, they had covered outdoor seating. Indoor seating was a little crammed, but I loved the decor.
thoughts.taste: . The coffee was pretty diluted, didn’t quite taste the espresso at all.

name: Telegraphe Cafe
visitAgain: 2 - Would stop by if I stumble upon this place again

thoughts.vibe: It’s a little too busy being right off a very busy street. Didn’t really like the vibe of the person taking our order, had some weird interactions in the span of 3 minutes. Decor is nice, good working space generally with a bunch of outlets.
thoughts.taste: Pretty standard latte, nothing really stood out. Little too cold even though I asked for it extra hot like I usually do. Good balance of creaminess and good consistency.

name: Vanilla Gorilla Coffee
visitAgain: 1 - Would not visit again

thoughts.vibe: : Super nice spot! Nice outdoor seating and indoor had good work spots.
thoughts.taste: : Got the pistachio cream, LOVED it. Super tasty, a little expensive but it’s a tasty treat in that way.

name: Fulcrum Cafe
visitAgain: 3 - Would visit again if I’m in the area

thoughts.vibe: . Super nice spot, not crowded, had some outdoor seating.
thoughts.taste: . Another one of those treat coffee places, once in a month but I had their white chocolate latte and it was quite fire.

name: Himalayan Java Coffee
visitAgain: 3 - Would visit again if I’m in the area

thoughts.vibe: . Modern decor that I really like! Located on a cute little corner. Enough seating space which honestly could be utilized better but pretty good place to work or just chill.
thoughts.taste: . Pretty good latte but the flavor was too dominated by milk. Good foam, but would’ve liked it to be a little stronger.

name: Grumpy Bean coffee
visitAgain: 3 - Would visit again if I’m in the area

thoughts.vibe: . Nestled in the back of a book store, very cozy and very cute.
thoughts.taste: . The latte was a little diluted, but tasted nice.

name: Elliot Bay Book Co
visitAgain: 3 - Would visit again if I’m in the area

thoughts.vibe: . I like the setup, it was a coffee bar with cute christmas decor.
thoughts.taste: . Got a cortado, which was pretty tasty

name: Hood Famous
visitAgain: 3 - Would visit again if I’m in the area
address:
504 5th Ave S
Unit 107A
Seattle, WA 98104

thoughts.vibe:
. 
This was small and not someplace I would stop to work while I drink my coffee. Felt barren and very robotic (bc it literally was)
thoughts.taste:
.
The coffee was actually great. Tasted fantastic, latte felt very much like a latte, everything blended together perfectly.

name: Artly Coffee
visitAgain: 2 - Would stop by if I stumble upon this place again

thoughts.vibe: : Good vibes, nice outdoor seating area. People were super nice.
thoughts.taste: . Well made, nothing special though. Good taste and standard latte!

name: Farine Cafe
visitAgain: 2 - Would stop by if I stumble upon this place again

thoughts.vibe: . Solid work spot. Would come here on a work meeting.
thoughts.taste: . Expected a lil more given that their branding was all about coffee roasting, but decent coffee nonetheless.

name: Umbria Cafe
visitAgain: 2 - Would stop by if I stumble upon this place again
